* [[Bing Maps]] Virtual Earth
* [[Bing Maps]] Virtual Earth

Wind energy-related data layers include the location of U.S. wind energy power plants; the NREL Wind Power Classification map; state-by-state Renewable Portfolio Standards, and installed wind capacity by state. Transmission & Infrastructure layers include the location of Transmission Lines (as shown by a 1993 report by [[FEMA]], [[NEXRAD]] RADAR sites, location of airports, location of railroads, and an open street map. [[Image:WENDI Wiki Photo 2.JPG|thumb|left|alt=WENDI Wind GIS showing the location of wind energy power plants, transmission lines, and ecoregions in the Northeast United States.|WENDI Wind GIS showing the location of wind energy power plants, transmission lines, and ecoregions in the Northeast United States.]] [[File:WENDI GIS Photo 3.JPG|thumb|WENDI Wind GIS showing installed wind capacity by state and NEXRAD RADAR sites.]] Geopolitical layers can be used to view 110th Congressional Districts of the US, country boundary, US states, US counties, and the population of US counties.
+
Wind energy-related data layers include the location of U.S. wind energy power plants; the NREL Wind Power Classification map; state-by-state Renewable Portfolio Standards, and installed wind capacity by state. Transmission & Infrastructure layers include the location of Transmission Lines (as shown by a 1993 report by [[FEMA]], [[NEXRAD]] RADAR sites, location of airports, location of railroads, and an open street map. Geopolitical layers can be used to view 110th Congressional Districts of the US, country boundary, US states, US counties, and the population of US counties.
The Hydrology layer allows the user to view the US river network. Land Ownership, Designation & Usage layers illustrate the boundaries of federal lands and Indian lands, as well as the renewable energy generation potential on [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|Environmental Protection Agency]] tracked sites according to the Office of Solid Waste and Emergency Response (OSWER) Center for Program Analysis (OCPA). Users can activate the Elevation or Land Cover layers to view related information.
The Hydrology layer allows the user to view the US river network. Land Ownership, Designation & Usage layers illustrate the boundaries of federal lands and Indian lands, as well as the renewable energy generation potential on [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|Environmental Protection Agency]] tracked sites according to the Office of Solid Waste and Emergency Response (OSWER) Center for Program Analysis (OCPA). Users can activate the Elevation or Land Cover layers to view related information.
